Description: Reddish brown glazed composition amuletic figure, rather crudely executed, in the form of a hare couchant, on a rectangular base, transversely pierced between the ears and the body for suspension.
Findspot: Excavated/Findspot: Tell Dafana, North-west Ptolemaic mound ?
Curator's comments: Certainly one of the 5 "rabbit" among the "glazed pottery amulets of late work, probably late Ptolemaic", from the North-west mound, mentioned by W.M.F. Petrie, Tanis ii, Nebesheh and Defenneh, p. 79 § 79.
Bibliographic references: Petrie 1888 / Tanis. Part II. Nebesheh (Am) and Defenneh (Tahpanhes) (p. 79 § 79)
Leclère and Spencer 2014 / Tell Dafana Reconsidered: The Archaeology of an Egyptian Frontier Town (p.40, p.45, p.63-64, p.180, pl.22)
